title: Hi, I am Pascal!
text:
Github
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Hi, I am Pascal!
Welcome to my website!
I’m a research professional specializing in ecology and environmental studies. With expertise in computational biology and bioinformatics, I explore the intricate dynamics of ecosystems. From uncovering hysteresis behavior in symmetric ecosystem models to simulating mutual inhibition-driven ecosystems, I strive to understand and contribute to our understanding of the natural world.
Join me as I showcase my research experience, including my role as a Research Assistant at the University of Zurich, where I’m working towards publishing key results. I’ve also completed an internship in ecology, delving into the fascinating topic of ecosystem behavior under mutual inhibition.
In addition to my research pursuits, I hold a Bachelor’s degree in Biology and Computational Science, and I’m currently pursuing my Master’s degree in Computational Biology and Bioinformatics at ETH. I’ve been recognized for my academic achievements, including the semester prize I received for my internship thesis.
Beyond my academic pursuits, I’ve gained valuable experience in logistics, military service, and healthcare. With advanced programming skills in Python and R, I bring computational prowess to my research endeavors.
Explore my website to learn more about my work, skills, and achievements. Get in touch if you’d like to collaborate or discuss exciting opportunities!

title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.
